Entries.default: "Please sir, a coin!" The child moves closer and tugs at the hem of your garments.
Entries.female: "Please madam, a coin!" The child moves closer and tugs at the hem of your garments.

Entries.default: In the midst of this pitiful gesture, the urchin's hand discreetly dips into your coin purse.
"Scram, kid."
"Nobody steals from me, you little thief!"
[Grab her by the arm.]
"Run for it!" The urchin lets out a piercing whistle to alert the others.
"Let me go! I'll give it back - please!"
"I don't want to see you trying this again."
The urchin gives a panicked nod and scurries away.
"Not a chance."
The urchin bows and scurries away.
"Spare a coin?"
"Got any food?"
"Those performers are so beautiful..."
"There's a crazy person on my heels! Help!"
The urchin looks up at you with wide, sorrowful eyes.
The child's eyes widen in panic, spurring a brief and fruitless struggle to escape.
"Stay out of trouble."
"Hey, thanks!" The coin vanishes up the urchin's sleeve.
A small movement draws your eye, and you notice the urchin's hand slipping into your coin purse.
[Say nothing.]
[Lie] "I haven't got anything."
The urchin regards you with a doubtful frown before moving on.
[Steal back five times what you lost.]
It takes a moment for the child to realize what happened. Their eyes open with wonder.
"That was amazing! I never felt a thing. If I were half so fast, I could pick every pocket in Queen's Berth!"
"What can I do for you?"
"I haven't got anything."
"Next time find someone distracted who hasn't got their bearings yet, you hear?"
"Where are your parents?"

"Gone, sir. I don't have nobody else." 

The urchin's eyes glisten with unshed tears.
Entries.female:
"Gone, miss. I don't have nobody else."

The urchin's eyes glisten with unshed tears.
